metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JSONP
JSONP is a method for sending JSON data without worrying about cross-domain issues.
content.html: JSONP is a method for sending JSON data without worrying about cross-domain issues.

content.text: JSONP does not use the XMLHttpRequest object.
content.html: JSONP does not use the XMLHttpRequest object.

content.text: JSONP uses the <script> tag instead.
JSONP Intro
JSONP stands for JSON with Padding.
Requesting a file from another domain can cause problems, due to cross-domain policy.
content.html: Requesting a file from another domain can cause problems, due to cross-domain policy.

content.text: Requesting an external script from another domain does not have this problem.
content.html: Requesting an external script from another domain does not have this problem.

content.text: JSONP uses this advantage, and request files using the script tag instead of the XMLHttpRequest object.
content.html: JSONP uses this advantage, and request files using the script tag instead of the XMLHttpRequest object.

content.code_html: <script src="demo_jsonp.php">

content.text: The Server File
The file on the server wraps the result inside a function call:
content.html: The file on the server wraps the result inside a function call:

content.code_html:
<?php
$myJSON = '{ "name":"John", "age":30, "city":"New York" }';

echo "myFunc(".$myJSON.");";
?>

content.text: The result returns a call to a function named "myFunc" with the JSON data as a parameter.
content.html: The result returns a call to a function named "myFunc" with the JSON data as a parameter.

content.text: Make sure that the function exists on the client.
content.html: Make sure that the function exists on the client.

content.text: The JavaScript function
The function named "myFunc" is located on the client, and ready to handle JSON data:
content.html: The function named "myFunc" is located on the client, and ready to handle JSON data:

content.code_html:
function myFunc(myObj) {
  document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = myObj.name;
}

content.text: Creating a Dynamic Script Tag
The example above will execute the "myFunc" function when the page is loading, based on where you put the script tag, which is not very satisfying.
content.html: The example above will execute the "myFunc" function when the page is loading, based on where you put the script tag, which is not very satisfying.

content.text: The script tag should only be created when needed:
content.html: The script tag should only be created when needed:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
function clickButton() {  let s = document.createElement("script");  s.src = "demo_jsonp.php";  document.body.appendChild(s);
  }

content.code:
function clickButton() {  let s = document.createElement("script");  s.src = "demo_jsonp.php";  document.body.appendChild(s);
}

  }

content.code_html:

  let s = document.createElement("script");
  s.src = "demo_jsonp.php";
  document.body.appendChild(s);
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
function clickButton() {  let s = document.createElement("script");  s.src = "demo_jsonp.php";  document.body.appendChild(s);
  }

content.text: Dynamic JSONP Result
The examples above are still very static.
content.html: The examples above are still very static.

content.text: Make the example dynamic by sending JSON to the php file, and let the php file return a JSON object based on the information it gets.
content.html: Make the example dynamic by sending JSON to the php file, and let the php file return a JSON object based on the information it gets.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<?phpheader("Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8");$obj = 
  json_decode($_GET["x"], false);
  $conn = new mysqli("myServer", "myUser", "myPassword", "Northwind");
  $result = $conn->query("SELECT name FROM 
  ".$obj->$table." LIMIT ".$obj->$limit);$outp = array();
  $outp = $result->fetch_all(MYSQLI_ASSOC);echo "myFunc(".json_encode($outp).")";?>

content.code:
<?phpheader("Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8");$obj = 
json_decode($_GET["x"], false);
$conn = new mysqli("myServer", "myUser", "myPassword", "Northwind");
$result = $conn->query("SELECT name FROM
".$obj->$table." LIMIT ".$obj->$limit);$outp = array();
$outp = $result->fetch_all(MYSQLI_ASSOC);echo "myFunc(".json_encode($outp).")";?>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<?phpheader("Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8");$obj = 
  json_decode($_GET["x"], false);
 $conn = new mysqli("myServer", "myUser", "myPassword", "Northwind");
  $result = $conn->query("SELECT name FROM 
  ".$obj->$table." LIMIT ".$obj->$limit);$outp = array();
  $outp = $result->fetch_all(MYSQLI_ASSOC);echo "myFunc(".json_encode($outp).")";?>

content.code_html:
<?php
header("Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8");
$obj = json_decode($_GET["x"], false);

$conn = new mysqli("myServer", "myUser", "myPassword", "Northwind");
$result = $conn->query("SELECT name FROM ".$obj->$table." LIMIT ".$obj->$limit);
$outp = array();
$outp = $result->fetch_all(MYSQLI_ASSOC);

echo "myFunc(".json_encode($outp).")";
?>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<?phpheader("Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8");$obj = 
  json_decode($_GET["x"], false);
  $conn = new mysqli("myServer", "myUser", "myPassword", "Northwind");
  $result = $conn->query("SELECT name FROM 
  ".$obj->$table." LIMIT ".$obj->$limit);$outp = array();
  $outp = $result->fetch_all(MYSQLI_ASSOC);echo "myFunc(".json_encode($outp).")";?>

content.text: PHP File explained:

content.code_html:
const obj = { table: "products", limit: 10 };
let s = document.createElement("script");
s.src = "jsonp_demo_db.php?x=" + JSON.stringify(obj);
document.body.appendChild(s);

function myFunc(myObj) {
  let txt = "";
  for (let x in myObj) {
    txt += myObj[x].name + "<br>";
  }
  document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = txt;
}

content.text: Callback Function
When you have no control over the server file, how do you get the server file to call the correct function?
content.html: When you have no control over the server file, how do you get the server file to call the correct function?

content.text: Sometimes the server file offers a callback function as a parameter:
content.html: Sometimes the server file offers a callback function as a parameter:

content.code_html:
let s = document.createElement("script");
s.src = "jsonp_demo_db.php?callback=myDisplayFunction";
document.body.appendChild(s);
